Summary It's all about the thrill of the chase, but also coupled with an important impact on eventual diagnosis/treatment of narcolepsy and Kleine Levin syndromes. I am happy collaborating or taking lead in important research projects. My work has been cited in nearly 2000 peer-reviewed publications as of 2011. My background is incredibly diverse, and I thrive on exploring new ventures. It's all about the thrill of the chase, but also coupled with an important impact on eventual diagnosis/treatment of narcolepsy and Kleine Levin syndromes. I am happy collaborating or taking lead in important research projects. My work has been cited in nearly 2000 peer-reviewed publications as of 2011. My background is incredibly diverse, and I thrive on exploring new ventures. Experience Senior Research Scientist Stanford University School of Medicine January 2005  – Present (10 years 8 months) Senior Reserach Scientist Stanford University 2005  – Present (10 years) Genome Wide association studies for loci involved in Narcolepsy and Kleine Levin Syndrome disease susceptibility, and sleep traits. Including data prep/curation, imputation, statistical analysis. Platforms: Affymetrix 500K set, Affy 6.0, Illumina ImmunoChip. 
 
Heavy participation in preparation of manuscripts and grant submissions from our lab. Notable expertise in scientific writing. 
 
General Expert-Doc-Friday help when a good brain and very little direction are required in a hurry. Post Doctoral Fellow/ Research Associate Stanford Center for Narcolepsy January 1996  –  2005  (9 years) Palo Alto California In my initial postdoc project, I used a novel genome-jumping strategy based on conserved synteny to identify new BAC clone seeds to cover the emerging critical region in canine narcolepsy. Methods included pre-genome era bioinformatics to identify human clones for use in cross species hybridization of a canine genome library. This was followed by cytogenetic analysis to determine whether the identified clones were in the critical region, as well is interphase FISH to determine relative position. BAC clones were then turned into plasmid libraries to develop genetic markers for linkage/finemapping, chromosome walking to extend and merge contigs, and serve as sources for other potential human-canine seed development.  
 
Second Post doc project focused on mutational analysis of hypocretin related genes in typical/ sporadic and unusual cases of narcolepsy which would more likely harbor mutations. Identified the only hypocretin mutation known, causing onset at 6 months. Functional analysis of identified mutation, showing abnormal trafficking/ impact on cells.  
 
Following these, I participated in the development of our zebrafish research projects, primarily focusing on identification, cloning and expression characterization of known sleep-related genes in the zebrafish. Creation of transgenic GFP fish lines. Promoter analysis of zebrafish hypocretin gene. Graduate Student Dept. Genetics Stanford University/ Francke laboratory 1990  –  1996  (6 years) Thesis research in human genetics focused on extracellular matrix abnormalities and the Marfan Syndrome. Additional studies screening candidate genes for familial hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Research associate California Biotechnology 1986  –  1988  (2 years) Early RFLP genetic marker development focused on candidate cardiovascular disease and osteoporosis loci. Bone formation model work in rodents. Summary Innovator in technologies that extend human intelligence, individually and collectively. Co-founder, CTO, and VP Design for Siri, which created the Virtual Personal Assistant on iPhone. Co-founder and CTO of RealTravel.com, where the world of travelers share their advice and experiences. Co-founder and CTO of Intraspect Software, a leader in collaboration and knowledge management solutions for the enterprise. Research scientist at the Stanford University Knowledge Systems Laboratory, where he was known for work in ontology and intelligent human-computer interaction. Specialties:Entrepreneur, CTO, product strategist, experience designer. Experience in designing products and building companies in consumer and enterprise that combine high tech software and innovative user experience. Known for published research in Artificial Intelligence, Ontology Engineering, and Human-Computer Interaction. Special expertise in collective intelligence, collaborative knowledge management, ontology design, and user adoption of innovative services. Summary Stephen Richardson is a research scientist in Stanford's Electrical Engineering department. He has authored or co-authored several papers and patents, mostly dealing with various aspects of computer architecture. Among other industry and research positions, Dr. Richardson was a co-founder of Micro Magic, Inc. and later became acting head of a computer hardware research group in HP Labs. Summary Hands-on expertise in in-vivo and in-vitro pharmacology, toxicology and molecular biology of painkillers with multiple approaches in acute, chronic pain and inflammatory models. Develop new pain model, pain behavorial testing and animal surgery. Great experience of consulting service in development and evaluation of new compounts. Specialties:Pain and inflammatory models, pain behavorial assay, animal surgery, drug administration, Inflammatory mediators including cytokines, statistical analysis. Conduct evaluation of new compound in animal model. Scientist Stanford University July 2008  –  June 2010  (2 years) 1. Lead pain projects 
2. Pain sensitivity assessment 
3. Development of new pain model and testing method 
4. Training new team member. Scientist Anesiva Inc August 2006  –  June 2008  (1 year 11 months) Pain models and pharmacology: 
Developed research projects and set up pain study Lab. 
Established acute and chronic pain models relevant to disease. 
Responsible for all in vivo related activities including team building and training. 
Evaluated and screened drug candidate efficacy by multiple animal behavioural measurements. 
Pain related nervous biomarker development: 
Set up Immunohistology Lab and Molecular Biology Lab. 
Developed and executed the project to analyze the nervous markers by immunohistochemistry and Western blot. 
Toxicology:
